result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas R Johnson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Refund of bond posted. Case dismissed.: Dennis Dean Johnson
Defendant Nicholas R Johnson in court with attorney Robert W. Buckett.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. On motion of the State, Court orders case dismissed and readin.
Jury status hearing on May 21, 2015 at 08:45 am.
Jury trial on May 27, 2015 at 08:45 am.

Defendant Nicholas R Johnson in court with attorney Robert W. Buckett.  Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel advises still has not received paperwork from def's other counsel, understands court may set for jury trial at this time.  State has no objection to setting both for trial, but if not, this case to be set.  Jury trial scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 08:45 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for May 21, 2015 at 08:45 am.
Further proceedings on February 19, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Nicholas R Johnson in court with attorney Robert W. Buckett.  Jeffrey A. Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Buckett stated he has held a pretrial with the State. Atty. Buckett needs additional time to review bailjumping charge.  Further proceedings scheduled for February 19, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Further proceedings on January 14, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Nicholas R Johnson in court with attorney Robert W. Buckett.  Patti L. Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives preliminary hearing on 14CF131/14CF307. Court examines defendant, accepts waiver and binds case over for trial. State files information. Defendant waives reading and enters not guilty plea.  Further proceedings scheduled for January 14, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Nicholas R Johnson in court with Attorney Rachel Alme-Boaz as a friend of the Court.  Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Ozaukee County Jail. Patti L. Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Alme-Boaz waives reading of Complaint and requests Status of Preliminary Hearing be set as counsel waives time limits. Attorney Alme-Boaz also advises Attorney Buckett is appointed on 2014CF131 and will be appointed on 2014CF307.
State requests $8,000 cash bail to cover 2014CF131 and 2014CF307. Attorney Alme-Boaz requests previous bail be reinstated on 2014CF131 and signature bond for 14CF307.
Court finds probable cause and orders $250 cash bail for each file 2014CF131 and 2014CF307. Court takes no action on the request to reinstate bail counsel is advised to address with Branch 1. 
Matter adjourned to December 10, 2014 at 10:00 a.m. for status on preliminary hearing.
